results.title: Automation: what it is and what it does
results.brief_description: Explores the meaning and levels of automation from an electric can opener to transfer machines in an assembly line to the more sophisticated feed back of a computer controlled refinery. Encourages the student to explore the implications of increasing automation for the future. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Automatic process control
results.brief_description: Illustrates the advantages to be derived from applying automatic control to a process in a small chemical plant. The four modes of control are discussed: on/off; proportional; proportional with reset; proportional with reset and rate action. An application of instrumentation for continuous process control is explained.
results.description: Illustrates the advantages to be derived from applying automatic control to a process in a small chemical plant. The four modes of control are discussed: on/off; proportional; proportional with reset; proportional with reset and rate action. An application of instrumentation for continuous process control is explained.

results.title: Autobahn
results.brief_description: An animated film by John Halas which attempts to convey the experience of a car journey in the form of abstract imagery. Animation, movement, colour and sound are combined to emphasise Kraftwerk’s famous musical composition. Intended audience: secondary school through adult.

results.title: Auto suggestion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
Illustrates technical advances in the British motor-car industry showing the fine quality and workmanship of products manufactured. Cars shown include the following: Daimler Straight Eight, Rolls-Royce Silver Wraith, Morris Minor, Vauxhall Wyvern, Austin A40, Hillman Minx, Ford Prefect, Triumph Mayflower, Jaguar XK120 amd Mark VII Saloon, Ford Consul, Triumph Roadster, production version of the 2.1/2 litre Aston Marton, Bristol 401, and the experimental Rover Gas Turbine prototype.

results.title: Auto stories
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, December Films, Tony Wright and Stuart Menzies
results.brief_description: Automobiles play a dominant role in 20th century society, making a personal statement about the owner and providing them with a functional vehicle, and for some - an obsession. These 4 half hour segments are united by the fascination between people and their cars. “Affairs of the heart” (Dir: Steve Westh): Dennis, proud owner of Marilyn Monaro - a 1975 Holden Monaro GTS coupe reminisces about past journeys in the vehicle as he prepares to put it on the market. His wife, Rhonda, describes how she copes with her husband’s obsession, meanwhile, we get to spend a day with employees and potential car owners at Melbourne’s Cheapest Car Supermarket. “Wrong way: go back” (Dir: Catherine Marciniak): Follow Vic Roads traffic clearer Neil Dwight as he makes sure the arterials of Melbourne are free from obstruction. The program also follows the decision making process of the Knox City Council as they grapple with the proposed Scoresby Freeway. “Til death do us part” (Dir: Fiona Hergstrom): Speed, alcohol and young males, what is the correlation? A young male involved in a car accident involving alcohol describes how it has affected his life since then. We also witness young drivers at a driver education centre as they go through the ropes of safe driving. “A Little inconvenience” (Dir: Helen Gaynor): Louise scours for someone to insure he Renault after it is involved in a minor accident. The process proves to be a lot lengthier than anticipated.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Australia, December Films, Tony Wright and Stuart Menzies
